Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Altimeter Sensor-Interim Geophysical Data Record (S-IGDR)

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: i. High resolution bathymetry is used to separate the coastal and land waveforms.

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: ii. Waveforms are classified based on their shape.

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: iii. Waveforms are retracked with the beta parameter retrackers (BETA5 and BETA9) and BAGP (Brown with asymmetric Gaussian Peak) retracker to get sea surface height (SSH), sea surface height anomaly (SSHA), significant wave height (SWH) and wind speed.

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: iv. Using Significant Wave Height (SWH) and wind speed, the wave period is derived based on the data adaptive technique of " Genetic Algorithm " (Remya et al. 2011)

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: v. Wave power is derived based on SWH and estimated wave period. 40 Hz data is filtered using a lanczos filter to remove high frequency noise.

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: vi. Wind power is calculated using standard wind power formula. 40 Hz data is filtered using a lanczos filter to remove high frequency noise.

Page Title: Indian Mainland Coastal Product | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Amarouche L, Thibaut P, Zanife O.-Z, Dumont, P. Vincent J.-P. and Steunou N 2004. Improving the Jason-1 ground retracking to better account for attitude effects, Mar. Geod. 27: 171-197.
